Dataset Overview

This comprehensive dashboard presents an analysis of 4,207 total cybersecurity patent records filed between 2019 and 2025. The dataset contains 3,888 unique patents (319 duplicates). The patents are categorized across five key technology domains:

  • Zero-Day Simulation - 1,211 patents (28.78%)
  • Privacy-Preserving - 930 patents (22.11%)
  • Synthetic Data Generation - 807 patents (19.18%)
  • Core Threat Detection - 671 patents (15.95%)
  • Adaptive Defense - 588 patents (13.98%)

Note: Use the "All Patents" / "Unique Patents" toggle in the Patent Explorer to switch between viewing all records or only unique patents.

Key Findings

  • Data Quality: 3,888 unique patents identified from 4,207 total records (92.41% unique)
  • Growth Trends: Patent filings peaked in 2023 with 1060 patents, showing a 64.70% growth from 2022
  • Geographic Leaders: China leads with 1,915 patents (46.27%), followed by the United States with 1,220 patents (31.37%)
  • Innovation Hotspots: Zero-Day Simulation and Privacy-Preserving technologies dominate the landscape
  • Corporate Leaders: Major assignees include Nvidia, Zscaler, IBM, Microsoft, Google, and various Chinese universities

Patent Filing Timeline Analysis

Timeline Insights

The patent filing timeline reveals significant growth in cybersecurity innovation:

  • 2019-2020: Initial growth phase with focus on Core Threat Detection
  • 2021-2022: Rapid expansion in Privacy-Preserving technologies
  • 2023: Peak year with 1060 patents filed, 64.70% growth
  • 2024-2025: Market consolidation with focus on Zero-Day Simulation

Key Insights from Assignee Analysis

  • Nvidia Corporation leads with 185 patents, focusing on AI acceleration and security
  • Zscaler, Inc. (102 patents) specializes in cloud security with GenAI integration
  • Traditional tech giants (IBM: 55, Cisco: 45) show moderate but steady involvement
  • Chinese universities dominate academic contributions but with lower per-assignee volume
  • Top 20 assignees hold only 23% of patents, indicating a highly distributed innovation landscape
